Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within St. Helena Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Dist. Prop. 1 -- 16.40 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage)

Summary:  10 year, 16.40 mills property tax of the Parishwide School District of the Parish of St. Helena to provide funding for the payment of salaries and benefits of certified and non-certified employees of the Parish School Board.
Race.FullText: Shall Parishwide School District of the Parish of St. Helena, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a tax of sixteen and forty hundredths (16.40) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $698,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023, for the purpose of providing funding for the payment of salaries and benefits of certified and non-certified employees of the Parish School Board?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW School Dist. Prop. 2 -- $8,000,000 Bond - SB - 40 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Bond)

Summary:  To authorize not exceeding $8,000,000 of not exceeding 40 year General Obligation Bonds of Parishwide School District of the Parish of St. Helena for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds to be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall Parishwide School District of the Parish of St. Helena, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Eight Million Dollars ($8,000,000), to run not exceeding forty (40) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate or rates not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated 9.4 mills to be levied in the first year of issue to pay said Bonds?
